For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/mahaveer.Mahaveer.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run mahaveer.Mahaveer.main()` (if the
code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something
like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)
Mahaveer is a console-based task management chatbot inspired by Lord Mahaveer. It helps you manage tasks efficiently using simple commands. This guide covers its features and usage.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Nice! I've marked this task as done: [T][X] Walk the dog
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: [T][ ] Walk the dog
The specified task is removed from the list.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Jai Jinendra! Till we meet next time :)
- Inspired by the Duke chatbot concept from [CS2113](https://github.com/nus-cs2113-AY2425S2/ip).
Enjoy using Mahaveer Chatbot! For questions or feedback, feel free to reach out.
* The main class for the Mahaveer chatbot application.
* This class initializes the UI, storage, and task list,
* then continuously processes user commands until an exit command is issued.
* The main entry point of the application.
* This method parses the user input, executes the corresponding command,
* and returns a boolean indicating whether the exit command was issued.
* @param ui       the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage  the storage for persisting task changes
* @return {@code true} if the executed command is an exit command, {@code false} otherwise
private static boolean processCommand(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The Parser class is responsible for reading user input from the UI,
* parsing the input into a command and its arguments, and returning a
private static final Ui ui = new Ui();
* Reads and parses the user command from the UI.
* This method trims the input, splits it into a command keyword and its
* arguments, and returns a ParsedCommand record with the command details.
* Depending on the command, it may throw a MaheveerException if the input
* is empty or does not match the expected format.
* @return a ParsedCommand record containing the parsed command, number (if applicable),
* task description, extra detail (e.g., deadline time or event start), andâ€º
* @throws MaheveerException if the input is invalid or does not meet the command format
public static ParsedCommand getCommandDetails() throws MaheveerException {
throw new MaheveerException("No command provided. Please enter a command.");
return new ParsedCommand("bye", null, "", null, null);
return new ParsedCommand("list", null, "", null, null);
return new ParsedCommand("mark", number, "", null, null);
throw new MaheveerException("Please provide a valid task number.");
return new ParsedCommand("unmark", number, "", null, null);
throw new MaheveerException("Please provide a valid task number.");
return new ParsedCommand("delete", number, "", null, null);
throw new MaheveerException("Please provide a valid task number.");

throw new MaheveerException("A 'todo' requires a short description.
For example:
  todo Bake a cake
  todo Walk the dog");
return new ParsedCommand("todo", null, rest, null, null);

throw new MaheveerException("A 'deadline' requires a description and '/by' time.
For example:
  deadline Submit assignment /by tonight
  deadline Finish reading /by next Monday");
throw new MaheveerException("Invalid deadline format. Use: deadline <description> /by <time>");
return new ParsedCommand("deadline", null, deadlineParts[0].trim(), deadlineParts[1].trim(), null);

throw new MaheveerException("An 'event' requires a description plus '/from' and '/to'.
For example:
  event Conference /from Monday /to Wednesday
  event Birthday party /from 2pm /to 6pm");
throw new MaheveerException("Invalid event format. Use: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
throw new MaheveerException("Invalid event format. Use: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
return new ParsedCommand("event", null, description, fromToParts[0].trim(), fromToParts[1].trim());
throw new MaheveerException("A 'find' requires a description.\nFor example:\n  find read book");
return new ParsedCommand("find", null, rest, null, null);
throw new MaheveerException("I'm sorry, I don't understand what you want me to do :c\nPlease refer to: ojassurana.github.io/ip for manual!");
* Immutable record representing the parsed command details.

*
  • extra - additional detail such as deadline time or event start

*
  • extra2 - additional detail such as event end
public record ParsedCommand(String command, Integer number, String task, String extra, String extra2) {
* The Storage class is responsible for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* It provides methods to add, delete, mark, and unmark tasks.

* If the file is created for the first time, it prints a confirmation message.

* The Ui class handles all user interactions, including reading user input
* and displaying messages to the console.
* Constructs a new Ui instance and initializes the input scanner.
* Displays a simple line separator to the console.
* Reads the next line of input from the user.
* @return the user input as a String
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println(SEPARATOR_LINE + " Hello! I'm Mahaveer!\n What can I do for you?\n" + SEPARATOR_LINE);
* Displays the specified message to the user.
* @param message the message to be displayed
* Abstract class representing a command in the Mahaveer application.
* Concrete command classes must extend this class and implement the {@code execute} method.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws MaheveerException if an error occurs during command execution
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException;
* Indicates whether this command signals the application to exit.
* @return {@code true} if this is an exit command; {@code false} otherwise
* The CommandFactory class is responsible for creating concrete Command objects
* based on the parsed user input.
* Creates and returns a specific Command instance based on the provided
* @param parsedCommand the parsed command containing the command type and arguments
* @return a concrete Command instance corresponding to the parsed command
* @throws MaheveerException if the parsed command is invalid or unrecognized
public static Command getCommand(ParsedCommand parsedCommand) throws MaheveerException {

* The DeadlineCommand class handles the addition of a deadline task.
* It creates a new deadline task with a description and a "/by" time,
* adds it to the task list, displays a confirmation to the user, and saves it in storage.
* Constructs a new DeadlineCommand with the specified description and deadline time.
* Executes the command to add a deadline task.
* This method checks if the description and deadline time are valid, creates a new deadline task,
* adds it to the task list, shows a confirmation to the user, and saves the task to storage.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws MaheveerException if the description or deadline time is invalid
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException {
throw new MaheveerException("A 'deadline' requires a description and '/by' time.\n"
+ "For example:\n  deadline Submit assignment /by tonight\n  deadline Finish reading /by next Monday");
ui.showToUser("Got it. I've added this task:");
* The DeleteCommand class handles the deletion of a task.
* It removes a task from the task list based on its number,
* shows a confirmation message to the user, and updates the storage.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task number.
* @param taskNumber the number of the task to delete (1-indexed)
* Executes the command to delete a task.
* This method calculates the zero-based index from the task number,
* deletes the task from the task list, displays a confirmation message,
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws MaheveerException if the task number is invalid
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException {
throw new MaheveerException("Task number does not exist.");
ui.showToUser("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* The EventCommand class is responsible for adding a new event task.
* It encapsulates the event's description along with its start and end times.
* When executed, it creates an Event task, adds it to the task list, and saves the task in storage.
* Constructs an EventCommand with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param from        the start time of the event
* @param to          the end time of the event
public EventCommand(String description, String from, String to) {
* Executes the command to add a new event task.
* This method validates the event details, creates an Event task, adds it to the task list,
* displays a confirmation message to the user, and updates the storage.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws MaheveerException if the event details are invalid
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException {
if (description.isEmpty() || from == null || from.isEmpty() || to == null || to.isEmpty()) {
throw new MaheveerException("An 'event' requires a description plus '/from' and '/to'.\n" +
"For example:\n  event Conference /from Monday /to Wednesday\n  event Birthday party /from 2pm /to 6pm");
Task task = new Event(description, from, to);
ui.showToUser("Got it. I've added this task:");
* The ExitCommand class handles the exit operation for the Mahaveer application.
* When executed, it displays a farewell message to the user and signals the application to exit.
* This method displays a farewell message on the user interface.
* @param tasks   the current task list (not used)
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showToUser("Jai Jinendra! Till we meet next time :)");
* Indicates that this command signals an exit.
* @return {@code true} indicating that the application should exit
* The FindCommand class handles searching for tasks that match a specified query.
* When executed, it filters tasks in the task list by checking if each task's description
* contains the given query (case-insensitive) and displays the matching tasks to the user.
* Constructs a new FindCommand with the specified search query.
* @param query the query string used to search for matching tasks
* This method iterates over all tasks in the task list, collects tasks whose descriptions
* contain the query (ignoring case), and displays either the matching tasks or a message
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system (not used by this command)
* @throws MaheveerException if an error occurs during execution
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException {
ui.showToUser("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* The ListCommand class is responsible for listing all the tasks in the task list.
* When executed, it displays a message indicating either that there are no tasks available
* or it prints each task with its index.
* This method displays all tasks in the provided task list to the user via the UI.
* If there are no tasks, it shows a message stating that no tasks are available.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system (not used in this command)
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showToUser("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* The MarkCommand class handles marking a task as done.
* When executed, this command retrieves the task corresponding to the provided task number,
* verifies that it is not already marked as done, and then marks it as completed.
* The change is updated in the storage and a confirmation message is displayed to the user.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task number.
* @param taskNumber the 1-indexed number of the task to be marked as done
* This method calculates the zero-based index of the task, checks if the index is valid,
* and then marks the task as done if it is not already completed. It updates the storage
* and displays an appropriate message to the user.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for persisting changes
* @throws MaheveerException if the task number is invalid or the task is not found
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException {
throw new MaheveerException("Task number does not exist.");
ui.showToUser("This task is already marked as done!");
ui.showToUser("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* The TodoCommand class handles adding a new todo task.
* It creates a new Task with the provided description, adds it to the task list,
* displays a confirmation message to the user, and updates the storage.
* Constructs a new TodoCommand with the given task description.
* @param description the description of the todo task
* This method validates the task description, creates a new Task, adds it to the task list,
* displays a confirmation to the user, and saves the task in storage.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws MaheveerException if the description is empty
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException {

For example:
  todo Bake a cake

* The UnmarkCommand class handles marking a task as not done.
* When executed, this command retrieves the task corresponding to the provided task number,
* verifies that it is currently marked as done, and then unmarks it.
* It updates the storage and displays a confirmation message to the user.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified task number.
* @param taskNumber the 1-indexed number of the task to be unmarked
* This method calculates the zero-based index for the task, validates it,
* retrieves the task, and if it is marked as done, it unmarks it.
* The change is then reflected in the storage and a confirmation is displayed.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for persisting changes
* @throws MaheveerException if the task number is invalid or the task is not found
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MaheveerException {
throw new MaheveerException("Task number does not exist.");
ui.showToUser("This task is already marked as not done!");
ui.showToUser("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* The MaheveerException class represents custom exceptions that occur
* within the Mahaveer application. It extends the standard Exception class,
* allowing for error messages specific to the application's domain.
* Constructs a new MaheveerException with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message explaining the exception
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {
return "[E][" + getStatusIcon() + "] " + description + " (from: " + start + " to: " + end + ")";
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
